page.title: 34CROSSING PATROL OFFICER
page.content:
We talked to Colin Jackson about his job as the crossing patrol officer for our primary school.

We asked Colin if he likes his job and he told us he did, because he likes working with children. We then asked him how long he has been working as a crossing patrol officer and found out he has been doing this for 2 and half years. He started his job on the 6th of October 2008. He doesn't work at weekends because the school is closed.

We then asked him more about his job. He told us that he had never dropped the lollypop stick on a car. He also said that everyone is really polite - they say please and thank-you after he has helped them across the busy main road.

He works for 1 and half hours per day, split into 2 sessions a day, one in t he morning and one in the afternoon.

Colin helps on average 40 children per day to cross the road safely.

All the children at St. Mary's Primary really love having Colin as our Crossing Patrol Officer because he has a wonderful personality, great sense of humour and his really kind to everyone. Thank you Colin for your help.
Jordan, Luke, Zack and Connor O - Y5 pupils from St. Mary's, Timsbury.
